title: Alcoa's stock jumps toward 3-year high after military coup in Guinea

contentObject.content: Shares of aluminum maker Alcoa Corp. (AA) rose 2.3% in premarket trading Tuesday, putting them on track to open at a three-year high, as a military coup in Guinea has sent aluminum futures prices to a 10-year high. Alcoa's stock has soared 25.1% over the past three months to close Friday at the highest price since July 18, while the S&P 500  has gained 7.3% the past three months. Among shares of other aluminum companies see premarket activity, Century Aluminum Co. (CENX) rallied 2.3%, Kaiser Aluminum Corp. (KALU) and Arconic Corp. (ARNC) edged up 0.1%. Guinea is a global supplier of bauxite, which is used in manufacturing aluminum. A faction of Guinea's military said over the weekend that the country's constitution had been suspended and President Alpha Conde had been detained.
